reviewText: This is a great concert.  My favorite song by her is True Colors, and she does a very special performance of it here.  She has an amazing voice and can still go get those ultra high notes.  It's fun to listen to her New York accent.  I grew up in Queens about the same time she did.Her song selection is also perfect for me.  Besides the songs associated with her, she did two songs that mean a lot to me - At Last and Unchained Melody.  Like she says, great minds think alike.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Hey all!Here's my review of the Cyndi Lauper "At Last" DVD.I can't get over how good Cyndi looks, sounds and dances, on stage. She seems more like 18 than 48 years old!Her Montreal performance of the "At Last" concert was nothing compared to this DVD!What a fantastic woman Cyndi is!For those of you who haven't been to Cyndi's "At Last" tour, You MUST buy this DVD!It's packed with so much energy and excitement.I must admit...Right now, I don't particularly care for the "At Last" CD, compared to the DVD.Cyndi's voice is more powerful and true, during this concert.For the title track, Cyndi outdid herself 300%.She stunned me, from the moment she walked out onstage, both at the actual Montreal concert, and on the DVD.I've already watched the DVD 3 times in 3 days!For those who aren't particularly in love with Cyndi's "acoustic" voice, i think you'll be amazed at just how well she pulled off this live concert DVD.My favorite parts of the show are:At last (because Cyndi sounds so much more "in tune" than on the CD)Stay (Cyndi's comedic "explanation" and her interaction with the band)If you go away (The dark, deep feeling of the song)She Bop (the intimate, closeness of Cyndi & band)Sisters of Avalon (I love everything about this song)True Colors (The story behind the song is very sentimental)Shine (What a powerful song!)Unchained Melody (the images while Cyndi's singing are great)Time after time (an upbeat touch has been put on this song)That makes almost half of the DVD really worth watching, even though the whole thing is great.For those of you who really mocked the "At Last" CD, I think you'll be more happy to have the DVD, considering Cyndi doesn't do anything boring during the concert.There are definitely some "die-hard" Pop-Cyndi fans, who despise Cyndi's vocal capabilities on the At Last" CD.Well....I think she has more than made up for any problems she may have had, in the studio.Her live voice is incredible!The only gripe I have regarding the DVD?There should have been a photo gallery and maybe a couple more songs.I noticed that they didn't put "Ballad of Cleo and Joe" on the DVD, even though Cyndi sang it, here in Montreal.You'll notice the love Cyndi and her audience have for each other. There's a lot of contact between Cyndi and the audience, which is so cool.The tracklisting is:1- Program Start2- At Last3- Stay4- I Drove all night5- If you go away6- All through the night7- Walk on by8- Don't let me be misunderstood9- She Bop (accoustic version)10- Sisters of Avalon11- Change of heart12- True colors13- Shine14- It's hard to be me15- Money changes everything16- Unchained Melody17- Time after time18- Girls just want to have fun19- CreditsThe Bonus features are:- Widescreen Concert- Shot in High definition- PCM Stereo- Dolby Digital 5.1 Surround Sound- "Stay" Music Video- Behind the Scenes- Alternate Angles- DiscographyGo and buy yourself a copy of this DVD! You won't regret it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I grew up listening to Cyndi. I still have several of her albums. Every one must evolve and in many ways Cyndi has for the better. There is a major problem with this album however. A few songs that are classics and sung strait forward are executed very well by Cyndi.  However others are experimental in nature and distort the original feel with extra warbling and la-di-dah. Of the ones that were not distorted and are classic, you find yourself saying "now who sings that?" instead of listening to Cyndi. "Walk on by" has someone making raspy sounds on the drum loud enough to make you stop and check for a flat tire.She will challenge and maybe best the original with "Don't Let Me be misunderstood." I am proud of the fact she can sing in English regardless if it has a French title. And there is a pamphlet with the explanation of her strange mix of songs in this album.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been a casual fan of Cyndi Lauper's since she hit it big with Girls Just Want to have Fun.I like a few of her songs and even own two albums.  After seing this DVD I am now completely converted.  She is without a doubt a consummate performer.  Her voice seems stronger than ever and what she does with words in her songs is inspired and touching.I also love how she is unpredictable and one gets the feeling that every night she would do something different onstage and not follow a routine a la Madonna/Britney/Cher etc etc.She is also very personable and you feel as though she really wants to connect with her audience and take them on a journey.Well done!

reviewText: Track listing:Program Start, At Last, Stay, I Drove All Night, If You Go Away, All Through The Night, Walk On By, Don't Let Me Be Misunderstood, She Bop, Sisters Of Avalon, Change Of Heart, True Colors, Shine, It's Hard To Be Me, Money Changes Everything, Unchained Melody, Time After Time, Girls Just Want To Have Fun, Credits.One thing that has always been true about Cyndi Lauper is that she will go out of her way to give her fans a great live show, regardless of whether she's performing at a small record store for free or at a sold-out major event concert. The location and number of people attending doesn't matter...Cyndi gives everything she's got when she performs live. And this new DVD "Live At Last," recorded at her March 11, 2004 gig at The Town Hall in New York, is certainly no exception. This DVD will surely satisfy both long-time fans as well as those who have only recently discovered Cyndi's music with her most recent album "At Last," as the track listing (see above) contains songs from both her old-school catalog as well as her renditions of the classics. I certainly appreciate her newer stuff but to me, the best part of this concert is hearing and seeing her perform her trademark songs such as the beautiful "Time After Time" and my personal favorite, "I Drove All Night." These songs may have been written a long time ago, but Cyndi proves with this concert that time certainly has not taken away any of the magic that made them so great.There are also some great bonus features, a lot more substantial than what most concert DVD's offer:Stay Music VideoForest ParkDriving With CyndiSunday DinnerBroad ChannelShoot It Yourself! with Cyndi and KevinAlternate AnglesDiscographyAll in all, a must-have for any Cyndi Lauper fan, even the casual one. And for the price that it's offered here you would be crazy not to buy it.
summary: After all these years, Cyndi still has it going on
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am so happy that I bought Cyndi Lauper's DVD -- Live...At Last. The quality of this DVD is superb.  Now, add Cyndi and it is above and beyond amazing. Cyndi's live performance (taped on March 11, 2004) in New York city at Town Hall, is a thrill to watch.  She interacts with the audience in true Cyndi style.  She talks about some of her songs and how they came to be.  Ah, and she makes you laugh.  Well, she made the audience laugh and me as well.  She rocks, bops, and has fun.  Cyndi's voice is strong, beautiful, and amazing as ever. The bonus features on the DVD are a celebration and put meaning to the term. You get to take a drive with Cyndi and hear and see her point out places where she grew up and from where she drew inspiration. This is special and a collection in it's self, as are all the extra features.  Buying this DVD, I got more than my money's worth.  Cyndi does not disappoint.
summary: Fantastic DVD + Bonus Features! Cyndi Lauper Live...At Last.

reviewText: As I watch Bette Midler begin her long (and I hope slow) ride off into the sunset by way of Las Vegas, I have been wondering who could fill her enormous shoes as pop music's premier interpreter.  Cindi Lauper, whom I vaguely remembered as a brief phenomenon way back when, had never crossed my mind as a candidate.Then, a couple of weeks ago, I was visiting some friends in Vermont who said, "you've got to watch this concert we TiVo'd".  For the next two hours I sat spellbound as this little dynamo of a woman overwhelmed the stage and most of the auditorium with one idiosyncratic and gripping interpretation after another of songs we thought we knew.  Convinced, I promptly raced to the internet to order the closest thing I could find to that concert, and I somehow wound up with four copies (don't ask) of her 2004 "Live at Last" DVD.I popped one copy into my player, thinking to do just a quick check to see how similar it was to the concert I heard in Vermont, since some of the songs were carry-overs.  Once again, I found myself nailed to the couch for the next two hours, mesmerized by a voice that wailed, soared, pined, and whispered from one piece of quirky material to the next.And it wasn't just Lauper that wove the spell.  Her backup musicians, including a violinist who apparently could nail Paganini's "Caprices" without breaking a sweat, were themselves superb.The coup de grace came, however, when Lauper hauled out a brass and sax section for her final number, a novel arrangement of her signature tune "Girls Just Want to Have Fun".  In delivering this standard as you've never heard it before, after almost two-hours of unbroken singing, coddling, and stage stomping, Lauper engaged in a vocal duel with a solo trumpet.  And, for a moment, the voice and the trumpet became indistinguishable.Ah . . . . .  I can sleep again.  With a judicious selection of future material, Lauper is poised to take the baton hand-off from the Divine Miss M herself.  And -- dare I say it? -- with a considerably more impressive vocal instrument.Wowza.

reviewText: I bought this DVD in 2003 somewhat on a lark, as it was cheap and contained her biggest hits. When I finally got around to putting this show on with my undivided attention, I immediately placed Cyndi Lauper into my limited collection of favorite singer/ songwriters.I had cherished a few songs from SHE'S SO UNUSUAL and maybe a song or two after. Never, in my wildest dreams was I prepared for her to showcase such fantastic pipes as in her rendition of AT LAST and WALK ON BY. More so, she performed some magical songs that I had never heard before, which to me, are the the greatest songs in Cyndi's repertoire... I looked up the song I DROVE ALL NIGHT and found that it was a minor hit from an album release of which I had never heard about. More so, she had a collection of albums of which I had never heard about... and that some truly wonderful tracks were among them... such as SALLY'S PIGEONS (not performed on this show.)And boy does this Queen not drag about in her very sexy black dress and her beautifully coifed blonde tresses. I never realized just how beautiful is Cyndi Lauper until I saw her slink, flirt and laugh throughout the show... (especially her incredibly cute facial expression when surprised by a female fan helping her back up on stage with a push on her derriere)... that shows that this girl (more so than any Madonna, Britney, or any other yadda yadda so-called performer) is a true musician who loves music and knows the difference between music and pop performances.This DVD is a must have for any Cyndi Lauper fan... and if you ask me, should be watched by any real rock fan with enough of an open mind to give a listen to a lady who has matured into a truly amazing musician.Kudos to Cyndi Lauper... she really knows how to have fun and plays wonderful music while doing so.
summary: Zowee, who knew that this girl had such talent?

reviewText: I have to add praise to the chorus... this dvd is wonderful. Cyndi looks and sounds incredible. Besides all the wonderful extras on the dvd, such as the behind the scenes stuff, alternate angles, and music video for Stay, the sound and picture are perfect quality. reviewText: I had previously seen her Live in Paris concert, and picked up this DVD to see her perform the newer material in a live setting. The concert is very intimate, despite taking place in a rather large concert hall. Lauper's personality and wit shine through during her conversations with the audience between songs. As for the performances themselves, the Amazon reviewer is quite correct regarding her voice - Cyndi is still at the peak of her vocal talents. She's always been underrated as a vocalist, and the quality of her performance on this DVD will no doubt surprise some.
summary: Cyndi Lauper impresses with new concert CD

reviewText: This concert will knock your socks off! Cyndi Lauper in "Live...at Last!" delivers a performance which is engaging,powerful,wistful and blatantly sincere. I disagree with the editorial review as pertains to the critical comments on 'the standards' Cyndi covers. "If You Go Away" is heart-wrenching without being sappy, and the power with which Cyndi delivers the Chorus will rattle your teeth! "Unchained Melody" is done with soul without going 'over the top', and of course her own opus' are done flawlessly. I love the dulcimer in "Time After Time", "Girls Just Want to Have Fun" is done with a 'fun' Calypso beat and the substantively performed "True Colors" will have you reaching for a hanky. The first time I heard Cyndi in the early 80's I was surprised that such deeply profound, soulful sounds can come out of someone of less than towering physical stature. Well, with Cyndi the grand architecture is there for the asking- You'll find it in her Heart and Lungs! What a show-Wow!
summary: Power,Performance and an Intimate Sincerity which is Palpable!
Title: N/A

reviewText: We all know Cyndi.  She sings those 80's classics like Time After Time and Girls Just Want To Have Fun.  But who knew what a dynamic performer she was?  Well, I did, and now the rest of the world can experience Cyndi Lauper, who I've been told is 50, in no way, shape or form is like any other 50 year old you have ever seen perform.  Not only does she capture your attention from the very beginning with her excellent vocal prowess dextermity on At Last but she lights up the stage even when the lights are low.  Cyndi doesn't owe the music world anything, the music world owes her if anything.  In just 16 songs, Cyndi manages to hit almost every genre of popular music without her or her band missing a beat.  She moves like she never had an ache or pain in her life, and her interaction with the audience was not only welcomed, it was FUN.  I even invited some friends over and put it on without telling them what it was.  By the time Cyndi sang Sisters of Avalon, everyone was shocked, surprised and delighted at how diverse a performer Cyndi Lauper really is.  Where has she been?  Well, it doesn't matter because she's back.  Oh, I know, she was perfecting herself to present you with this DVD.
summary: One Of the Best Concert Videos EVER!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: With a power packed voice like that, Cyndi Lauper doesn't need pre-recorded live tracks on her tours. You know that she is definitely singing live.Live...At Last is full of innovation. I love her covers of 50s and 60s numbers. Stay goes cha cha while Walk On By is thankfully not a Dionne Warwick sound-a-like like so many covers. She Bop is done in a French cafe rendition and Girls Just Wanna Have Fun goes Conga ala Gloria Estefan. She can be wistfully tender (If You Go Away) or she can really rock your socks out (Change Of Heart).Cyndi may not have that orange/yellow hair, shredded newspaper skirt and a million bangles anymore but she still a live wire on stage, regaling the crowd with stories of her hometown and early life. She still dances wildly, plays some instruments and even runs down to the audience to sing lying across their laps. And not forgetting those trademark 'hiccups'.As a fan, I appreciate the inclusion of the bonus material which lets me get to know Cyndi the person a little better.Live...At Last was an absolute delight to watch from start to finish. And Lauper's performance blew the roof right off! Whew!

reviewText: From cat-wauling kwepie of the early 80s to the devastating diva witnessed on this DVD, the Cyndi Lauper journey has been astonishingly rich. She has always possessed an arresting voice. Increasingly, with astute direction, her material has given vent to a range of emotion that is peerless in the pop province. During this mesmerizing New York Town Hall set from 2004 she pitches her voice with the same impeccable ease with which she inhabits a restrained and evocative choregraphy. Not that there's any restraint in her singing! But there are no funny clothes, wigs or smoke and the only pyro-technics are provided by string players, Kat Dyson on lead, and Deni Bonet on fiddle. Fortunately, being a concert, we have Lauper's Brooklynese banter to break the overwhelming circuitry of the music; throaty lust, stomach-grinding loss, heart-beating anticipation, and good old groin honey Rock. I wasn't even a fan, so the DVD(courtesy of my 17 year old) was some revelation. What a dame! 'Devastating' in that these performances obliterate prior versions. Her,'Unchained Melody', and 'If You Go Away' are sacred moments full of grace. And 'True Colours', is definitive. Most of her CD,'At Last' is here, and material pulled from earlier days is apt. She could make, as they say, the recitation of the telephone directory, something memorable.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD is a must-have to fans all over the world. After years on the shadows, Cyndi shines on her own show, showing how talented she is. This shows features classical american songs, taken from "At last" album, as well as Cyndi's 80's hits, in new versions. The performance of Cyndi is amazing and she really interacts with her audience between the songs, explaining what inspired her to write them or the influence they had in her life and childhood. I love her guitar version of "Walk on by" (different from "At last" album), as well as "If you go away" and "Don't let me be misunderstood", which are really touching on Cyndi's powerful vocals. I was glad to see her performing old classics that made part of my life on the 80's, such as "Change of heart", "Time after time", in an acoustic version, "True colors", amazing as always, and "Girls just wanna have fun", in a salsa special version. I missed the goonies song, which is never included in Cyndi's setlist. I don't know why, because it is incredible and people really enjoy it! Cyndi's band is outstanding. The bass player and the violin player are great and very 80's! If you like Cyndi Lauper, or at least love to see live performances on DVD, get your copy right now! Cyndi is back, finally, at last!
Title: N/A

reviewText: You know, I love Cyndi Lauper!  She's  a fabulous singer and entertainer.  She's very warm and passionate to her fans.  I wish I would have seen her live.  But....this performance just didn't move me very well.  She did some covers on some old rock standards (she really added some realistic emotion to "Don't Let Me Be Misunderstood"), But, other covers just kinda bored me ("If You Go Away" sounded like she was stoned and couldn't get up off the floor, the original version from Terry Jacks* is so much better).  I also didn't care too much about her own hits being altered so much.  She just didn't express the energy that I expected.  I really do hope that they will release her video concert from 1987 "Live in Paris" on DVD some day soon.  I guess, because she was younger then, the energy was there.Sorry Cyndi, but I still do love you for what you've contributed to early MTV and the pop sound of the eighties.*Terry Jacks biggest hit was "Seasons in the Sun.
summary: I'm not too impressed, I'm sorry to say.

reviewText: Do not let the price fool you, this is a high-quality concert! Rarely have I seen a live concert DVD (or video) with this quality. The picture, the sound, and OH! Cyndi Lauper's performance!The songs she sings on this DVD are as follows:At Last--Which she performs with amazing talent and strength.Stay--A nice song with a great story before she begins to sing.I Drove All Night--She performs this one brilliantly.If You Go Away--Good song.All Through The Night--She sings it great live-which is hard to imagine.Walk On By--Very well done.Don't Let Me Be Misunderstood--Outstanding performance!She Bop--A slower version of the song, and done with a new kind of attitude.Sisters Of Avalon--A good song from one of my favorite albums!Change Of Heart--She really gets into this one with the foot stomping!True Colors--Great, great, great!Shine--Vocals are always strong, and on this one-brilliant!It's Hard To Be Me--Nice story at the beginning, and she gets into this one a lot too.Money Changes Everything--OUTSTANDING!Unchained Melody--This has to be a hard song to sing live, but she pulled it off. It shows her vocal talent, and she is superb.Time After Time--One of her biggest hits, and the song is done great!Girls Just Want To Have Fun--She seems to be enjoying herself!DON'T GET ME WRONG--every single song on this album is great-brilliant! I gave a list of the songs she sings, and what I thought of each song. She is truly a remarkable entertainer, and she proves it on this DVD. Anyone who is interested in her music should buy this DVD!
